gurmukhi: AQ hir ko AkRUr mQurw ko lY jYbo ]
transliteration: Ath Har(i) Ko Akroor Mathuraa Ko Lai Jaibo||
translation: Now begins the description of taking of Krishna to Mathura by Akrur

gurmukhi: irpu ko hir mwr gey jbhI AkRUr ikDO cil kY iqh AwXo ]sXwm ko dyiK pRnwm krXo Apny mn mY Aiq hI suKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Rip(u) Ko Har(i) Maar Gad Jab-hiakroor Kidhau Chal(i) Kai Tih Aayo|| Syaam Ko Dekh(i) Pranaam Daryo Apne Man Mai At(i) Hisoukh(u) Paayo||
translation: When, after killing the enemy, Krishna was about to go, Akrur arrived there; seeing Krishna and being-extremely pleased, he bowed before him;

gurmukhi: kMs khI soaU kY ibnqI jdurw Apny ihq swQ irJwXo ]AMkis so gj ijau iPrIXo hir ko iqm bwqn qy ihr lXwXo ]790]
transliteration: Kans Kahisooo Kai Bintijaduraa Apne Hit Saath Rijhaayo Ankas(i) So Gad Jio Phireeyai Har(i) Ko Tim Baatan Te Hir Lyaayo||790||
translation: Whatever Kansa has aksed him to do, he did accordingly and thus delighted Krishna; just as the elephant is directed according to one’s wish with the aid of goad, in the same way Akrur, with the persuasive talk, got the assent of Krishna.790.

gurmukhi: suin kY bqIXw iqh kI hirjU ipq Dwm gey ieh bwq sunweI ]moih AbY AkRUr ky hwQ bulwie pTXo mQurw hU ky rweI ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Bateeyaa Tih Kihar(i)joo Pit Dhaam Gad Eh Baat Sounaaee|| Moh(i) Abai Akroor Ke Haath Bulaae Pathyo Mathura Hoo Ke Raaee||
translation: Listening to his words, Krishna went to his father Nand and said, “I have been called by Kansa, the king of Mathura, to come in the company of Akrur;

gurmukhi: pyKq hI iqh mUrq nMd khI qumry qn hY kusrweI ]kwhy kI hY kusrwq khXo ieh BwNq bulXo muslIDr BweI ]791]
transliteration: Pekhat Hitih Moondat Nand Kahitoumre Tan Bai Kousraaee|| Kaahe Kihai Kousraat Kahyo Eh Bhaaee||791||
translation: Seeing Krishna, Nand said, “Are you alright?” Krishna said, “Why do you ask it?,” saying thus, Krishna also called his brother Balram.791.

gurmukhi: AQ mQurw mY hir ko Awgm ]
transliteration: Ath Mathuraa Mai Har(i) Ko Aagad||
translation: Now begins the description of the arrival of Krishna in Mathura

gurmukhi: suin kY bqIXw sMig gÍwrin lY biRj rwj clXo mQurw ko qbY ]bkry Aiq lY pun CIr Gno Dr kY muslIDr sXwm AgY ]
transliteration: Soun(i) Kai Bateeyaa San(i) Gvaaran(i) Lai Brij Raaj Chadyo Mathuraa Ko Tabai|| Bakre At(i) Lai Poun Chheer Ghano Dhar Kai Mousleedhar Syaam Agad||
translation: Listening to their talk and accompanied by the gopas, Krishna started for Mathura; they also took many he-goats with them and also great quality of milk; Krishna and Balram were in front;

gurmukhi: iqh dyKq hI suKu hoq Gno qn ko ijh dyKq pwp BgY ]mno gÍwrin ko bn suMdr mY sm kyhir kI jdurwie lgY ]792]
transliteration: Tih Dekhat Hisoukh(u) Hot Ghano Tan Ko Jih Dekhat Paap Bhagad|| Mano Gvaaran(i) Ko Ban Soundar Mai Sam Kehar(i) Kijaduraae Lagad||792||
translation: Seeing them extreme comfort is obtained and all the sins are destroyed; Krishna seems like a lion in the forest of gopas.792.

gurmukhi: mQurw hir ky jwn kI sunI jsoDw bwq ]qbY lgI rodin krn BUl geI suD swq ]793]
transliteration: Mathuraa Har(i) Ke Jaan Kisounijasodhaa Baat|| Tabai Lagirodan(i) Karan Bhool Gadsaat||793||
translation: When Yashoda heard about the departure of Krishna to Mathura, she began to lament, losing consciousness.793.

gurmukhi: rovn lwg jbY jsuDw Apuny muiK qy ieh BwNq so BwKY ]kohY ihqU hmro biRj mY clqy hir ko biRj mY iPir rwKY ]
transliteration: Rovan Laag Jabai Jasudhaa Apoune Moukh(i) Te Eh Bhant So Bhaakhai|| Kohai Hitoo Hamro Brij Mai Chalte Har(i) Ko Brij Mai Phir(i) Raakhai||
translation: While weeping, Yashoda said like this, “Is there anyone in Braja, who may stop the departing Krishna in Braja?
